metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14494 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
dnsmasq before 2.78, when configured as a relay, allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive memory information via vectors involving handling DHCPv6 forwarded requests.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.3
dnsmasq-base - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.3
dnsmasq-utils - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Felix Wilhelm, Fermin J. Serna, Gabriel Campana and Kevin Hamacher

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.3').
